workflow.name: Automate invoice processing with OCR, GPT-4 & Salesforce opportunity creation
workflow.description:
# PDF Invoice Extractor (AI)

End-to-end pipeline: Watch Drive ‚ûú Download PDF ‚ûú OCR text ‚ûú AI normalize to JSON ‚ûú Upsert Buyer (Account) ‚ûú Create Opportunity ‚ûú Map Products ‚ûú Create OLI via Composite API ‚ûú Archive to OneDrive.

---

## Node by node (what it does & key setup)

### 1) Google Drive Trigger
- **Purpose**: Fire when a new file appears in a specific Google Drive folder.
- **Key settings**:
  - Event: `fileCreated`
  - Folder ID: `google drive folder id`
  - Polling: `everyMinute`
  - Creds: `googleDriveOAuth2Api`
- **Output**: Metadata `{ id, name, ... }` for the new file.

---

### 2) Download File From Google
- **Purpose**: Get the file binary for processing and archiving.
- **Key settings**:
  - Operation: `download`
  - File ID: `={{ $json.id }}`
  - Creds: `googleDriveOAuth2Api`
- **Output**: Binary (default key: `data`) and original metadata.

---

### 3) Extract from File
- **Purpose**: Extract text from PDF (OCR as needed) for AI parsing.
- **Key settings**:
  - Operation: `pdf`
  - OCR: enable for scanned PDFs (in **options**)
- **Output**: JSON with OCR text at `{{ $json.text }}`.

---

### 4) Message a model (AI JSON Extractor)
- **Purpose**: Convert OCR text into **strict normalized JSON array** (invoice schema).
- **Key settings**:
  - Node: `@n8n/n8n-nodes-langchain.openAi`
  - Model: `gpt-4.1` (or `gpt-4.1-mini`)
  - Message role: **system** (the strict prompt; references `{{ $json.text }}`)
  - `jsonOutput`: `true`
  - Creds: `openAiApi`
- **Output (per item)**: `$.message.content` ‚Üí the parsed **JSON** (ensure it‚Äôs an array).

---

### 5) Create or update an account (Salesforce)
- **Purpose**: Upsert **Buyer** as Account using an external ID.
- **Key settings**:
  - Resource: `account`
  - Operation: `upsert`
  - External Id Field: `tax_id__c`
  - External Id Value: `={{ $json.message.content.buyer.tax_id }}`
  - Name: `={{ $json.message.content.buyer.name }}`
  - Creds: `salesforceOAuth2Api`
- **Output**: Account record (captures `Id`) for downstream **Opportunity**.

---

### 6) Create an opportunity (Salesforce)
- **Purpose**: Create Opportunity linked to the Buyer (Account).
- **Key settings**:
  - Resource: `opportunity`
  - Name: `={{ $('Message a model').item.json.message.content.invoice.code }}`
  - Close Date: `={{ $('Message a model').item.json.message.content.invoice.issue_date }}`
  - Stage: `Closed Won`
  - Amount: `={{ $('Message a model').item.json.message.content.summary.grand_total }}`
  - AccountId: `={{ $json.id }}` (from **Upsert Account** output)
  - Creds: `salesforceOAuth2Api`
- **Output**: Opportunity `Id` for OLI creation.

---

### 7) Build SOQL (Code / JS)
- **Purpose**: Collect unique product **codes** from AI JSON and build a SOQL query for **PricebookEntry** by `Pricebook2Id`.
- **Key settings**:
  - `pricebook2Id` (hardcoded in script): e.g., `01sxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx`
  - Source lines: `$('Message a model').first().json.message.content.products`
- **Output**: `{ soql, codes }`

---

### 8) Query PricebookEntries (Salesforce)
- **Purpose**: Fetch `PricebookEntry.Id` for each `Product2.ProductCode`.
- **Key settings**:
  - Resource: `search`
  - Query: `={{ $json.soql }}`
  - Creds: `salesforceOAuth2Api`
- **Output**: Items with `Id`, `Product2.ProductCode` (used for mapping).

---

### 9) Code in JavaScript (Build OLI payloads)
- **Purpose**: Join lines with PBE results and Opportunity `Id` ‚ûú build **OpportunityLineItem** payloads.
- **Inputs**:
  - OpportunityId: `={{ $('Create an opportunity').first().json.id }}`
  - Lines: `={{ $('Message a model').first().json.message.content.products }}`
  - PBE rows: from previous node items
- **Output**: `{ body: { allOrNone:false, records:[{ OpportunityLineItem... }] } }`
- **Notes**:
  - Converts discount_total ‚ûú per-unit if needed (currently commented for standard pricing).
  - Throws on missing PBE mapping or empty lines.

---

### 10) Create Opportunity Line Items (HTTP Request)
- **Purpose**: Bulk create OLIs via Salesforce Composite API.
- **Key settings**:
  - Method: `POST`
  - URL: `https://<your-instance>.my.salesforce.com/services/data/v65.0/composite/sobjects`
  - Auth: `salesforceOAuth2Api` (predefined credential)
  - Body (JSON): `={{ $json.body }}`
- **Output**: Composite API results (per-record statuses).

---

### 11) Update File to One Drive
- **Purpose**: Archive the **original** PDF in OneDrive.
- **Key settings**:
  - Operation: `upload`
  - File Name: `={{ $json.name }}`
  - Parent Folder ID: `onedrive folder id`
  - Binary Data: `true` (from the Download node)
  - Creds: `microsoftOneDriveOAuth2Api`
- **Output**: Uploaded file metadata.

---

## Data flow (wiring)

1. **Google Drive Trigger** ‚Üí **Download File From Google**
2. **Download File From Google**
   - ‚Üí **Extract from File**
   - ‚Üí **Update File to One Drive**
3. **Extract from File** ‚Üí **Message a model**
4. **Message a model**
   - ‚Üí **Create or update an account**
5. **Create or update an account** ‚Üí **Create an opportunity**
6. **Create an opportunity** ‚Üí **Build SOQL**
7. **Build SOQL** ‚Üí **Query PricebookEntries**
8. **Query PricebookEntries** ‚Üí **Code in JavaScript**
9. **Code in JavaScript** ‚Üí **Create Opportunity Line Items**

---

## Quick setup checklist

- üîê **Credentials**: Connect Google Drive, OneDrive, Salesforce, OpenAI.
- üìÇ **IDs**:
  - Drive Folder ID (watch)
  - OneDrive Parent Folder ID (archive)
  - Salesforce **Pricebook2Id** (in the JS SOQL builder)
- üß† **AI Prompt**: Use the strict system prompt; **jsonOutput = true**.
- üßæ **Field mappings**:
  - Buyer tax id/name ‚Üí Account upsert fields
  - Invoice code/date/amount ‚Üí Opportunity fields
  - Product `name` must equal your **Product2.ProductCode** in SF.
- ‚úÖ **Test**: Drop a sample PDF ‚Üí verify:
  - AI returns **array JSON** only
  - Account/Opportunity created
  - OLI records created
  - PDF archived to OneDrive

---

## Notes & best practices

- If PDFs are scans, enable OCR in **Extract from File**.
- If AI returns non-JSON, keep ‚Äú**Return only a JSON array**‚Äù as the last line of the prompt and keep `jsonOutput` enabled.
- Consider adding validation on `parsing.warnings` to gate Salesforce writes.
- For discounts/taxes in OLI:
  - Standard OLI fields don‚Äôt support per-line discount amounts directly; model them in **UnitPrice** or custom fields.
- Replace the Composite API **URL** with your org‚Äôs domain or use the Salesforce node‚Äôs **Bulk Upsert** for simplicity.

parameters.content:
# PDF Invoice Extractor (AI) to Salesforce Opportunity

What it does:
Watch a Drive folder ‚Üí OCR PDF ‚Üí extract invoices (JSON) via LLM ‚Üí mirror file to OneDrive ‚Üí upsert Buyer to Salesforce ‚Üí create Opportunity ‚Üí add Opportunity Line Items from Pricebook.


## Flow
 1)Drive Trigger ‚Üí 2) Download ‚Üí 3) Extract ‚Üí 4) ‚Üí 5) Upsert Account ‚Üí 6) Create Opportunity ‚Üí 7) Build SOQL ‚Üí 8) Query PBE ‚Üí 9) Build OLI ‚Üí 10) Create OLIs -> 11) OneDrive  


## Outputs
- LLM: normalized JSON array of invoices
- Salesforce: Account (buyer), Opportunity, Line Items
- OneDrive: original PDF archived

## Quick Troubleshooting
- Empty OCR ‚Üí enable OCR in step 3
- Non-JSON ‚Üí enforce jsonOutput:true + strict prompt
- Missing PBE ‚Üí verify ProductCode matches Salesforce & Pricebook2Id
- Auth errors ‚Üí re-connect Google/OneDrive/Salesforce/OpenAI

## Notes
- Keep numbers as JSON numbers; dates YYYY-MM-DD
- If fields missing, return null; log warnings in parsing.warnings
- Replace hardcoded IDs (Pricebook2Id, OneDrive Folder, SF domain) with your values

values.content:
=Role: You are a meticulous extractor. Given raw OCR text that may contain one or many tax invoices, return a normalized JSON array. Do not invent data. If a field is missing, use null (or []).

Input
- batch_text: {{ $json.text }}

Output
- Return only a JSON array. Each element is one invoice with the schema:

[
  {
    "seller": {
      "name": "string|null",
      "tax_id": "string|null",
      "address": "string|null",
      "phone": "string|null",
      "email": "string|null",
      "bank_account": "string|null",
      "bank_name": "string|null",
      "bank_branch": "string|null"
    },
    "buyer": {
      "name": "string|null",
      "tax_id": "string|null",
      "address": "string|null",
      "phone": "string|null",
      "buyer_representative": "string|null"
    },
    "invoice": {
      "type": "string|null",
      "issue_date": "YYYY-MM-DD|null",
      "code": "string|null",
      "symbol": "string|null",
      "number": "string|null",
      "payment_method": "string|null",
      "currency": "string",
      "lookup_url": "string|null",
      "lookup_code": "string|null"
    },
    "products": [
      {
        "name": "string",
        "description": "string|null",
        "unit": "string|null",
        "quantity": "number",
        "unit_price": "number",
        "discount_percent": "number|null",
        "discount_amount": "number|null",
        "subtotal_excl_vat": "number",
        "tax_rate": "number|null",
        "tax_amount": "number|null",
        "line_total": "number|null"
      }
    ],
    "summary": {
      "total_discount": "number|null",
      "subtotal_excl_vat": "number|null",
      "vat_rate": "number|null",
      "vat_amount": "number|null",
      "grand_total": "number|null",
      "amount_in_words": "string|null"
    },
    "software": {
      "issuer": "string|null",
      "issuer_tax_id": "string|null",
      "notes": "string|null"
    },
    "parsing": {
      "warnings": ["string"],
      "assumptions": ["string"]
    }
  }
]

Locale & normalization rules
1) Currency & numbers:
   - Detect currency (e.g., USD, EUR, GBP, VND, ‚Ç´, $, ‚Ç¨).
   - Remove thousands separators (., , or space).
   - Interpret decimals by locale (e.g., ‚Äú1,234.56‚Äù vs ‚Äú1.234,56‚Äù).
   - Use integers for zero-decimal currencies; otherwise decimals. If uncertain, keep decimal and add a warning.

2) Dates:
   - Normalize to YYYY-MM-DD from formats like dd/mm/yyyy, mm-dd-yyyy, yyyy.mm.dd, or ‚Äúdd Month yyyy‚Äù.
   - If ambiguous (e.g., 03/04/2024), infer from locale cues (currency/language). If still uncertain, set null and add a warning.

3) Line wrapping:
   - Merge wrapped product description lines until quantity/unit/price/tax columns or totals appear.

4) Discounts:
   - If only percent or amount present, compute the other when possible (round to nearest minor unit).
   - If discount appears as a negative line, treat as discount_amount.

5) Per-line taxes:
   - Capture per-line Tax/VAT rate/amount if shown; otherwise set products[*].tax_rate and tax_amount = null and rely on summary vat_rate.

6) Totals cross-check:
   - sum(products.subtotal_excl_vat) ‚âà summary.subtotal_excl_vat (¬±1 minor unit)
   - summary.vat_amount ‚âà round(subtotal_excl_vat * vat_rate/100)
   - grand_total = subtotal_excl_vat + vat_amount
   - If mismatch, keep parsed figures and append a parsing.warnings note.

Multi-invoice splitting (critical)
- Split batch_text into invoice blocks using anchors; each block = one invoice.

Primary anchors:
- ‚ÄúTAX INVOICE‚Äù, ‚ÄúINVOICE‚Äù, ‚ÄúVAT INVOICE‚Äù, or similar header; OR
- A cluster containing both ‚ÄúSerial/Symbol:‚Äù (or ‚ÄúSeries:‚Äù) and ‚ÄúNo./Number:‚Äù within ~10 lines.

Secondary boundaries (helpful, not required):
- ‚ÄúTax Authority Code / QR / Validation Code‚Äù near header
- ‚ÄúAmount in words:‚Äù or ‚ÄúTotal amount payable:‚Äù near the end
- Software footers (e.g., ‚ÄúIssued by ‚Ä¶ software‚Äù)

Heuristic:
- Start a new block when a header reappears or when ‚ÄúSeries/Symbol:‚Äù and ‚ÄúNo./Number:‚Äù occur after a prior ‚ÄúTotal amount payable‚Äù.

Extraction steps (per invoice block)
1) Seller/Buyer:
   - Anchors: Company/Organization, Tax ID/VAT No., Address, Phone, Email, Bank Account/IBAN, Bank Name, Branch.
   - Buyer: Customer/Buyer Name, Tax ID (if any), Address, Phone, Buyer Representative/Contact.

2) Invoice header:
   - Type, Issue date, Tax authority code (if any), Code (internal), Symbol/Series, Number, Payment method, Currency, Lookup URL/Code (QR/portal).

3) Items table:
   - Detect headers like: No., Item/Service, Unit, Quantity, Unit Price, Amount, Discount %, Discount Amount, Net before VAT, Tax/VAT, Line Total.
   - Rebuild wrapped descriptions; keep units as-is if unsure.

4) Summary:
   - Total discount, Subtotal excl. VAT, VAT rate, VAT amount, Grand total/Total payable, Amount in words, Lookup URL/code (if present).

5) Software/Notes:
   - E-invoicing platform or software issuer (name & tax ID if shown) and any footer notes.

6) Validate & warn:
   - Run cross-checks; record anomalies and assumptions (e.g., inferred decimal separator, currency, ambiguous date).

Strict formatting
- Output only the JSON array (no extra text).
- All numeric fields must be JSON numbers.
- Use UTF-8.
- Do not guess missing data.

Anti-hallucination
- If a field is not explicitly present or reliably derivable, return null.
- If per-line VAT isn‚Äôt printed, set products[*].tax_rate and tax_amount to null and compute only at summary level.
- If headers are partially missing due to OCR, infer columns from value patterns (units, prices \d[\d.,]*, discounts %, etc.). If uncertain, add a warning.

parameters.content:
## 1) Google Drive Trigger
- Op: fileCreated in folder (ID)
- Poll: every minute
- Creds: Google Drive OAuth2
- Note: Ensure access/Shared Drive rights

## 2) Download from Drive
- Op: download by {{$json.id}}
- Binary key: data (default)
- Creds: Google Drive OAuth2

## 4) Message a Model (JSON)
- Node: @n8n/n8n-nodes-langchain.openAi
- Model: gpt-4.1 (or gpt-4.1-mini)
- Prompt: strict schema; **return only JSON array**
- jsonOutput: true
- Output path (first item): $('Message a model').first().json.message.content

## 7) Code: Build SOQL (PricebookEntry)
- Node: Code (JS)
- Purpose: collect ProductCodes from LLM products ‚Üí build SOQL for PricebookEntry by Pricebook2Id
- Output: { soql, codes }

## 10) HTTP Request: Create Opportunity Line Items
- Method: POST
- URL: https://<your-instance>.my.salesforce.com/services/data/v65.0/composite/sobjects
- Auth: salesforceOAuth2Api
- Body (JSON): ={{ $json.body }}

## 11) Upload to OneDrive
- Op: upload
- Name: ={{ $json.name }}
- Parent Folder ID: (set)
- Binary: from step 2
- Creds: OneDrive OAuth2

user.name: Le Nguyen
user.bio: Salesforce Architect with 10+ years of experience in CRM, integrations, and automation. Skilled in Apex, LWC, REST APIs, and full-stack dev (JavaScript, .NET). I build secure, scalable workflows in n8n‚Äîconnecting Salesforce, Stripe, and more. Passionate about lead scoring, data sync, and secure field masking. Certified Application Architect with deep expertise in platform, integration, and data architecture.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.
